intro: Vincetoxicum oaxacanum, commonly known as Mexican devil's backbone, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Vincetoxicum oaxacanum is often found in disturbed areas and is considered an ornamental plant in some regions.
